bug.short_desc: Contrib Demobrowser should generate against the latest patch releases

long_desc.thetext:
The manifest files of contributions specify compatible qooxdoo versions. It is reasonable to just use minor versions (e.g. "1.4") for declaring such a dependency. As the qoxodoo release scheme follows semantic versioning, patch releases (e.g. "1.4.2") work as drop-in replacements for the corresponding minor release.
Therefore, when generating the demos for each contrib (or any other targets like api if appropriate), the latest existing patch release for each minor release should be used. This could possible be addressed in a pragmatic way by introducing and maintaining a release lookup table within the toolchain.

Fixed with r28412: As suggested by Andreas, I added a repository.py map to the repository module. Of course this needs to be updated manually for each new patch release. Added an entry to the "How to build a release" wiki page as a reminder.
